result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John E VanHara

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 7, 2023 at 09:45 am.

9:03 AM Defendant John E VanHara in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore in court for John E VanHara.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defense indicates she was recently assigned in one of the case files. Asks to be heard on bond today. Asking the court to consider a modification or a reduced cash bond of $100 in case 22CM1120. Defense makes statements on the record. Looking to resolve all these matters and is seeking a plea and sentencing date. 
State does not object to modifying the bond in case 22CM1120 to a signature bond. 
BTC: Cash bond is modified to $750 signature bond in case 22CM1120. Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:30 AM Defendant John E VanHara in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates he is seeking a bond reduction and states why. Seeking a small cash bond of $100. Has not met with Atty Moore face-to-face. 
State indicates there are victims in one of the case files ad cannot move forward with a bond hearing today. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to Withdraw
proposed order to withdraw
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:34 AM Defendant John E VanHara not in court. Attorney Erika Lynn Moore and Natalie Probst in court for John E VanHara. Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Attorney Moore indicates that both she and Attorney Probst were appointed as counsel for Mr. VanHara. Attorney Moore indicates she will be representing Mr. VanHara in all three matters. Provides explanation for why the defendant does not appear. 
State indicates there are no objections to staying a warrant. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited but stayed until the next court date. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John E VanHara appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for John E VanHara. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
